class_notes:
Anthropological theory and method in the 21st century: A practice based approach
Our aim in this class is to simultaneously learn about anthropological theories and explore these by interacting with real world data. To interact with data and the web, we will learn (and practice) a tool kit of computational skills that includes text mining, web scraping, data visualization, and basic statistical analyses. Our approach will be to focus on a specific theory, discuss it, and then explore it through data. We will aim to 'scrape' or collect the data by programming our computers to interact with the web. For example, we will explore theories about cultural evolution and then look to see how well those predict patterns in the Twitter-sphere. We will learn about theories relating geography to body shape, and then collect body size data from around the web to test how well these theories predict what we observe in the real world. After some introductory classes, we will focus on a different substantive topic each week. We will rely on the statistical program R but NO PROGRAMMING OR STATISTICS KNOWLEDGE OR EXPERIENCE IS NEEDED, just a willingness to learn something new.
